result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Dennis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manuf/Deliver Designer Drugs (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(hm)1.
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision are the same as conditions of probation.
Court has set a Probation Review Hearing for 1/04/18 at 3:00 pm.

miscConds.notes: $250 fine plus costs. (cash bond applied)   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
To repay Door/Kewaunee Drug Task Force for buy money. (this has been paid out of cash bond posted)
Maintain full-time employment and/or schooling. Graduate from high school or obtain GED/HSED.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with A.F. or anyone involved with illegal drugs.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes: To perform 40 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua J Dennis

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua J Dennis in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. Court questions defendant on how probation is going.  Defendant indicates he's done serving his jail sentence, is working full-time at Hatco. Defendant is making payments as he can, is involved in AODA treatment, needs to complete his community service yet. Defendant is still working on getting his GED and has reinstated his drivers license.  Court not setting another probation review hearing, agent can request hearing if he feels one is needed.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua J Dennis in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10 & 13. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10 & 13. Court dismisses remaining counts but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint setnencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.  Probation review hearing scheduled for January 4, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.
from Atty Reetz indicating the parties have reached an agreement, requests a plea/sentencing date in December. Court sets hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 12, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
from Atty Reetz with change of address for defendant.
Jury trial on February 15, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua J Dennis in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz indicates matter is not resolved, asks court to schedule matter for pretrial and trial. Set for pretrial and trial. (3 days). State withdraws their offer. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Joshua J Dennis in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz indicates matter is resolved, asks court to set a plea/sentencing date. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.
from Atty Reetz advising defendant started new employment at WireTech Fabricators on 3/14/16.

Defendant Joshua J Dennis in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz requests another status, possible plea in 30 days, has a few matters to work out yet. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Joshua J Dennis in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz asks court to modify bond from a cash bond to a signature bond to allow defendant to use the money to pay for treatment.  State objects to modification of bond, feels cash bond is appropriate. Atty Reetz responds to State's argument. Court makes statement, will consider modifying bond but would like to see written verification from Bellin indicating defendant is starting their program on 1/18/16 and what the cost will be. Atty Reetz will get that documentation. Court will then amend bond and transfer money to Atty Reetz's trust fund in the amount needed to pay treatment fee at Bellin. If defendant voluntarily leaves the 21 day program and there would be any refund, that money is to be returned to defendants bond account. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 11:30 am.
from Atty Reetz as a follow up to and in further support of Defendant's motion to modify bond. Court sets hearing.

Atty Reetz anticipates the Information mirroring the criminal complaint, based on that, Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Discussion regarding bond modification. Atty Reetz not asking court to modify bond today but hold that motion open. Court does so.   Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. State will file the Information and State's Discovery Demand in the next day.

Defendant Joshua J Dennis in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
